sentences.en: Fay also spotted camps of presumed poachers near elephant massacre sites.
sentences.cn: 凡在大象尸体附近也拍到了一些偷猎嫌疑人的照片.

sentences.en: He is collecting evidence to massacre his opponents.
sentences.cn: 他正在收集证据要彻底击败他的对手.

sentences.en: How did you manage to massacre your strong opponent?
sentences.cn: 你是如何设法彻底击败劲敌的?

sentences.en: In March 1770, there occurred what became known as the Boston Massacre.
sentences.cn: 1770年3月在那里发生了后来闻名的波士顿惨案。

sentences.en: Manchester City massacre , a new season set a team single - game scoring record.
sentences.cn: 曼城屠杀, 刷新了新赛季单场一队进球纪录.

sentences.en: Massacre at Fort Hood: The New Face of Terrorism?
sentences.cn: 胡德堡枪击案: 恐怖主义的新面孔?

sentences.en: Tens of thousands of dolphins and small whales are brutally massacred every year.
sentences.cn: 每年有数万条海豚和小鲸鱼惨遭杀戮。

sentences.en: The army massacred more than 150 unarmed civilians.
sentences.cn: 军队屠杀了150多名手无寸铁的平民。

sentences.en: the bloody massacre of innocent civilians
sentences.cn: 对无辜平民的血腥屠杀

sentences.en: The game was a complete massacre; we lost 10 - 0.
sentences.cn: 那次比赛真是一次惨败, 我们0比10输了.

sentences.en: the only survivor of the massacre
sentences.cn: 这场大屠杀的唯一幸存者

sentences.en: There was a terrible massacre of villagers here during the war.
sentences.cn: 在战争中,这里的村民惨遭屠杀.

sentences.en: This became known as the Tsinan Massacre.
sentences.cn: 这次屠杀事件被称为“济南惨案”.

sentences.en: This point was at issue in litigation resulting from the famous'saturday Night Massacre " incident.
sentences.cn: 这一点正是因有名的 " 周六夜间屠杀 " 事件而引发的诉讼争议的焦点.

sentences.en: Thus they created an incident known as the Boston Massacre.
sentences.cn: 他们就这样制造了一次事件,称为波士顿惨案.

sentences.en: Was he attempting to prepare a wholesale massacre to avenge his son?
sentences.cn: 莫非他企图把大伙都一网打尽来给他儿子报仇?

trans.tran_cn: 大屠杀，残杀，（牲畜的）成批屠宰
trans.tran_en: when a lot of people are killed violently, especially people who cannot defend themselves
when a lot of people are killed violently, especially people who cannot defend themselves
to kill a lot of people or animals in a violent way, especially when they cannot defend themselves

trans.tran_cn: 屠杀，残杀，损害，毁坏，<口>彻底击败，<口>惨败
trans.tran_en: to kill a lot of people or animals in a violent way, especially when they cannot defend themselves
